intro: Urera jacquinii var. ulmifolia, commonly known as the Ulmifolia Urera, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features slender, often hairy stems and elliptic to ovate leaves that are typically dark green and glossy. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are clustered in terminal panicles, adding ornamental value. The species is valued for its adaptability to tropical and subtropical climates and its use in horticulture.
